Reviews.Title: Great Basic Computer!
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: First off all, I don't understand the negative reviews! I have had nothing, but positive experiences with this computer. Having said that understand it is a everyday basic computer! It is not for gaming. It does everything it is supposed to do! The speed will depend on your internet provider not the computer. I run mine at 10 mbps as that is the fastest connection in my area currently. This speed is fine for me. I have had NO problems with pages loading or watching Netflix, Youtube, or any other videos! Dvds play flawlessly! Will play Hd content no problem. It has never been laggy or choppy at all. Overall, this for me, was an excellent purchase. I just had to learn how windows 8 works. I mainly use the desktop which mimics Windows 7. I am very picky and for the cost it beats a cheap tablet any day for the week!!! I guess, experience will depend on the person and what you want the computer to do! It meet and exceeded my espectations.

Reviews.Title: Works, but slowly
Reviews.Author: Andrea Polk
Reviews.Content: This is a slow, basic computer.  Don't expect it to easily multi-task (do several things at one time), or play the latest games requiring fast graphics.  The processor and cache are just not made to do it.  However, if your needs are minimal: email, Internet searches and online games like Solitaire, this will work for you.You can upgrade the memory in this PC to a maximum of 8GB of RAM by adding (1) 4GB dimm.  Unfortunately it won't help very much in terms of speed, as the processor and cache are also part of the equation.  It will help somewhat with freeze-up problems which you may encounter with only 4GB installed.It does have a media card reader, webcam and HDMI and VGA ports.  Three USB 2.0 ports are nice, but no USB 3.0 (the newest, faster standard) was disappointing, especially since it does have a HDMI port.  The keyboard is full sized, and responsive.There is both a Ethernet port (wired Internet) and Wifi adapter installed.  NO Bluetooth, but you can buy a Bluetooth adapter like this: Kinivo BTD-400 Bluetooth 4.0 USB adapter - For Windows 8 / Windows 7 / Vista which fits in a USB port and works very well.  They are about ten dollars.This PC is one I'd select if the price was low enough to give to my step-dad as a gift.  This is a guy who uses Google to search and Gmail to email.  He has discovered Ebay (much to my mother's chagrin...) and watches the occasional YouTube video.  Truly, a HP Chromebook 14-c050 (Sparkling Black) would do the trick for him, but he likes a bigger screen.Regarding price please note that during Black Friday this PC was less than two hundred, so paying more than three now would be silly.The HP 2000 series laptops are good machines, but look for one with a AMD 'A' processor with at least 3MB of L2 cache for the best performance.  The 1MB of L2 cache and the 'E' processor really make this PC very slow compared to others at this same price point.Video and sound are both OK, but nothing special.  Adding a Bluetooth speaker (with adapter - purchased separately) or headphones will help the sound.  The video is fine for online streaming and DVD watching, but not fast enough for serious gaming.Battery life is about 3.5 hours on a full charge, depending upon your usage.  If you're watching a DVD, the battery will drain faster than if you're emailing.This PC runs Windows 8, 64-bit.  I recommend you upgrade (for FREE) on the Microsoft website 'dowloads' to Windows 8.1 when you unpackage it - before adding other programs.  It adds a Start button that was part of Windows 7, but was missing from Windows 8, as well as a few other little things.  NOTE:  You get 60-Days FREE Norton Internet Security with this PC.This PC is nothing special, but as stated before, if the price is low enough, it'll be OK for the basics.These are the specs on this laptop, per the HP website:Microprocessor 1.3GHz AMD E-300 Accelerated ProcessorMicroprocessor Cache 1MB L2 CacheMemory 4GB DDR3 SDRAM (1 DIMM)Memory Max Maximum supported = 8GBMemory Slots 2 user accessibleVideo Graphics AMD Radeon HD 6310 Discrete-Class graphicsDisplay 15.6-inch diagonal HD BrightView LED-backlit display (1366x768)Hard Drive 320GB 5400RPM hard driveMultimedia Drive SuperMulti DVD burnerNetwork Card 10/100BASE-T Ethernet LAN (RJ-45 connector)Wireless Connectivity 1x1 802.11b/g/n WLANSound Altec Lansing dual speakersKeyboard: Full-size keyboardPointing Device Touchpad supporting multi-touch gestures with on/off buttonExternal Ports:  Multi-format digital media card reader for Secure Digital cards3 Universal Serial Bus (USB) 2.01 HDMI1 VGA (15-pin)1 Headphone-out1 Microphone-inDimensions 1.20 in (min H)/ 1.41 in (max H) x 14.80 in (W) x 9.72 in (D)Weight 5.39 lbPower 65W AC adapter6-cell 47WHr 2.2 Ah lithium-ion batteryFront facing HP TrueVision HD Webcam with integrated dual array digital microphone

Reviews.Title: HORRIBLE EXPERIENCE AND DISAPPOINTING CHRISTMAS GIFT
Reviews.Author: bj carter
Reviews.Content: This machine did not work !  If I could give it a 1/2 star I would.  First time my son (his Christmas gift) tried to boot up, it died.  After talking with an HP techie for more than an hour Christmas morning, it was determined that the hard drive was defective.  This machine is on it's way back to you for a refund.

Reviews.Title: freezes up
Reviews.Author: J. Aguilar "lastjedi"
Reviews.Content: this pc constantly freezes up.mainly on the pc stuff not the internet.like going to check a file or control panel.stuff like that.you can't do more than a few clicks and it freezes up.i have a very fast connection speed.but that doesn't matter.this pc has a ghz proccessor speed of 1.3 which is very slow.you can't even run avs video converter on this which requires a speed of 2.4 at least to run.i should have did my homework on this first before i purchased.but it was so cheap i bought it.i bought a lemon and am regretting it now.so bottom line is even if you just want to check your email and thats it you will still have problems doing that because i tried doing that and it took me like 10 tries before i could do that because it kept constantly freezing up.

Reviews.Title: Cheap Computer
Reviews.Author: Mona H.
Reviews.Content: The HP 2000, is very difficult to navigate. I purchased this computer because it was on sale for a good price. This computer was a lemon.The screen switches back and forth while you are typing. My computer kept freezing. A little over three weeks the keyboard would not work. I could not type at all. I removed the battery from the back of the computer to reboot it. It still did not resolve the keyboard issue. I wanted to send it back however, the 3d party store will not accept it back.There is a 30 day return policy that was not honored. I am trying to resolve returning the computer to the store. Unfortunately, I have not been successfully.  I was told to contact the manufacturer. It's true, you pay for what you get!Disappointed customer,Mona H.

Reviews.Title: great laptop
Reviews.Author: Steven E. Wolinski
Reviews.Content: I bought this for my girlfriend for Christmas and she loves it! we have no complaints about this laptop at all!

Reviews.Title: Meets my needs for a computer
Reviews.Author: Anita
Reviews.Content: This computer meets the my needs for what I do with a computer.  I have actually purchased 2 of these and have not been disappointed with the purchases.  I do not need a lot of different programs or software.  I have had other HP products and have always been pleased with their performance.  I would recommend this computer for anyone who just needs the basic programs this computer comes loaded with.  Purchasing on Amazon is simply the easiest thing in the world and I have never been disappointed with Amazon's service or delivery times.  Along with recommending this computer for people who only need the basics I would also recommend purchasing it on Amazon.

Reviews.Title: Garbage
Reviews.Author: anonymous
Reviews.Content: You might notice this HP doesn't recognize drivers. Pathetically, this piece of garbage won't even accept an external mouse or a jump drive. My mom talked me into buying this because it's an HP. No more. HP may have been a trusted brand 20 years ago. Now, it's junk.

Reviews.Title: Good Laptop With Great Portability
Reviews.Author: gregory c. phillips
Reviews.Content: Limited Connectivity. As Advertised Low Gaming and multi- media capabilities.  The Touch pad is Sticky and not responsive to clutch handling. Over all a Good Pc.

Reviews.Title: DO NOT BUY
Reviews.Author: Gerald Schlechter
Reviews.Content: This computer is the biggest piece of junk i bought. We have 2 older computers in our house that run faster.  I got it over the past weekend  took forever to load, came pre loaded with a bunch of junk programs.  Took 20+ minutes to download a new web browser (firefox).  Took minutes to load simple web pages  facebook, Cnn, etc.  I am returning this computer.  My 3+ year old iphone 4 loads and runs websites faster.  DO NOT BUY.

Reviews.Title: This HP computer has it all!!!
Reviews.Author: Teig Keenan
Reviews.Content: Though I am troubled about how sensitive the mouse pad is and even the slightest brush causes windows to close and the charms to reveal themselves. All in all though, it's a great computer. A little slick though--it has slipped out of my hands on more than one occasion.

Reviews.Title: Would be one star if they let you....
Reviews.Author: nanorman
Reviews.Content: I purchased this computer from HP 8 months ago. It has been in for repairs nearly every month. The HD has gone three times. To make matters worse, I purchased TWO HPs in the last 8 months (two different models from two different stores) and both have had NOTHING but problems.Up until this experience, I have been a loyal HP user for over 10 years. I will NEVER purchase another HP product again. Ever.Not only has the computer died repeatedly, I have spent hundreds of hours on the phone with tech support (none speak English and some can't understand me at all) and been LIED to repeatedly. Not misunderstandings, but actual bold faced lies that they then don't honor the next call. They transfer you from one place to another, 5-6 times per call, and all ask the same four questions.Bad form, HP.

Reviews.Title: DO NOT PURCHASE THIS!
Reviews.Author: 2Be Healthy
Reviews.Content: I bought this computer at the beginning of the fall semester of 2013. It is now midterm time just one semester later in 2014 and my computer screen stopped working. I took it into a tech and he said the video card when out for no apparent reason. I now had to convert this laptop into a PC and attach it to an HDMI cable just to use it. I will never purchase HP again. I was given no warning. I liked it until it crashed 6 months into the purchase.
